parameters.name: channel_id
parameters.description:
Specify the channel of content for the GetAssetChanges request. 
             Each channel contains changed assets based on criteria such as asset family,
             changed asset metadata, or the type of change to the asset (i.e. new, deleted, updated)

parameters.name: batch_size
parameters.description: Number of assets to return in the response. Default is 10; maximum is 500.

200.description: successfull operation.

parameters.name: date_from
parameters.description:
If specified, select assets downloaded on or after this date. Dates should be submitted in ISO
                8601 format (i.e., YYYY-MM-DD).

parameters.name: date_to
parameters.description:
If specified, select assets downloaded on or before this date. Dates should be submitted in ISO
                8601 format (i.e., YYYY-MM-DD).

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Size of page

parameters.name: product_type
parameters.description: Specifies product type to be included in the previous download results.

200.description: successfull operation. The response definition contains the entity attributes.

post.description:
The single step download call returns either a redirect or a response message with the URI to download the largest
                image available.
                Returns HTTP status code 303 Redirect to download URI or HTTP status code 200.

parameters.name: auto_download
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to auto-download the image. If true is specified, a 303 SeeOther status is returned with a
                    Location header set to the location of the image.
                    If false is specified, the download URI will be returned in the response message.

parameters.name: file_type
parameters.description: File Type expressed with three character file extension.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description:
Specifies the pixel height of the particular image to download.
                    Available heights can be found in the images/{ids} response for the specific image.
                    If left blank, it will return the largest available size.

parameters.name: product_id
parameters.description: Identifier of the instance for the selected product offering type.

parameters.name: product_type
parameters.description: Product type.

200.description: successfull operation.

post.description:
The single step download call returns either a redirect or a response message with the URI to download the largest
                video available.
                Returns HTTP status code 303 Redirect to download URI or HTTP status code 200.

parameters.name: auto_download
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to auto-download the video. If true is specified, a 303 SeeOther status is returned with a
                    Location header set to the location of the video.
                    If false is specified, the download URI will be returned in the response message.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Specifies the size to be downloaded.

200.description: successfull operation.

post.description:
The single step download call returns either a redirect or a response message with the URI to download the largest
                image available.
                Returns HTTP status code 303 Redirect to download URI or HTTP status code 200.

parameters.name: auto_download
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to auto-download the image. If true is specified, a 303 SeeOther status is returned with a
                    Location header set to the location of the image.
                    If false is specified, the download URI will be returned in the response message.

parameters.name: file_type
parameters.description: File Type expressed with three character file extension.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description:
Specifies the pixel height of the particular image to download.
                    Available heights can be found in the images/{ids} response for the specific image.
                    If left blank, it will return the largest available size.

parameters.description: Identifier of the instance for the selected product offering type.

parameters.name: date_from
parameters.description: If specified, retrieves previous purchases on or after this date. Dates should be submitted in ISO 8601 format (i.e., YYYY-MM-DD).

parameters.name: date_to
parameters.description: If specified, retrieves previous purchases on or before this date. Dates should be submitted in ISO 8601 format (i.e., YYYY-MM-DD).

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Current page number for results. The default is 1.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Page size for results The default is 75.

parameters.description: Restrict search results to embeddable images. The default is false.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: comma delimited list of fields to retrive for the video

200.description: successfull operation. The response definition contains the entity attributes.

editorial_segments.description: List of editorial segments for the image. Possible values are archival, entertainment, news, publicity, royalty, sport

id.description: An image id. For more than one image please use the /v3/images endpoint.

board_id.description: Id of board to get details and assets for.

product_types.description: License agreements for the video. Possible values are: premiumaccess, easyaccess, editorialsubscription, imagepack, royaltyfreesubscription

shot_speed.description: The speed the video was shot. Possible values are: real_time, slow_motion, time_lapse, and null

asset_family.description: Indicates the asset family classification. Possible values are: creative, editorial

color_type.description: Indicates whether the image is color or black and white. Possible values are color, black_and_white, and null

license_model.description: Identifies a licensing model for the image. Possible values are: royaltyfree, rightsready

era.description: The era of the video. Possible values are: archival, contemporary, and null

editorial_segments.description: List of editorial segments for the image. Possible values are archival, entertainment, news, publicity, royalty, sport
